result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Michael Konitzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Submit a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay all costs and surcharges by 03-25-16 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Michael Konitzer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Michael Konitzer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with credit for 17 days served.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 03-25-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Steven Michael Konitzer not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant is serving a sentence in Vernon County.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, Defendant Steven Michael Konitzer not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from Vernon/Clark County for purposes of this hearing. Agreed Upon Request For A New Court Date received, signed, and filed with court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Steven Michael Konitzer in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Steven Michael Konitzer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
